intro: Calosciadium antipodum, commonly known as the New Zealand cowpea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its small white or greenish flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calosciadium antipodum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by Māori for traditional healing purposes.
